page.title: 07LANDSCAPE-3
page.content:
The church of St.Lawrence at Oxhill and St. Peters Whatcote are built of the blue and brown Hornton stone with some light Lyas stone.Both have battlemented towers.The view from the towers is extensive with the well wooded Edgehill,Tysoe and Idlicote hills to the east and south and dominated by the crowned Brailes hill.
The gently rolling countryside around is a patchwork of fields of green in winter and spring turning to green and gold in late summer to be partly obscured by the smoke of stubble fires in autumn.Ploughing in autumn then turns the patchwork to green and brown with reds and yellows from the trees and hedges.
Low flying British jet aircraft are frequently seen and heard.
